@description.body:

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Shows a whole meta column. This includes a {@link Header},
a {@link Pane} and the needed scroll bars. This class handles the
virtual scrolling and does all the pointer event handling.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: pane {qx.ui.table.pane.Pane} table pane to show the data

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: focus-indicator {qx.ui.table.pane.FocusIndicator} shows the current focused cell

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-x {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
horizontal scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body:
scrollbar-y {qx.ui.core.scroll.ScrollBar?qx.ui.core.scroll.NativeScrollBar}
vertical scrollbar widget (depends on the "qx.nativeScrollBars" setting which implementation is used)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: table {qx.ui.table.Table} the table the scroller belongs to.
@param.description: the table the scroller belongs to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the horizontal scroll bar

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to show the vertical scroll bar

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The table pane model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether column resize should be live. If false, during resize only a line is
shown and the real resize happens when the user releases the pointer button.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether the focus should moved when the pointer is moved over a cell. If false
the focus is only moved on pointer taps.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether to handle selections via the selection manager before setting the
focus.  The traditional behavior is to handle selections after setting the
focus, but setting the focus means redrawing portions of the table, and
some subclasses may want to modify the data to be displayed based on the
selection.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the cell focus indicator should be shown

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
By default, the "cellContextmenu" event is fired only when a data cell
is right-clicked. It is not fired when a right-click occurs in the
empty area of the table below the last data row. By turning on this
property, "cellContextMenu" events will also be generated when a
right-click occurs in that empty area. In such a case, row identifier
in the event data will be null, so event handlers can check (row ===
null) to handle this case.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Whether to reset the selection when a header cell is tapped. Since
most data models do not have provisions to retain a selection after
sorting, the default is to reset the selection in this case. Some data
models, however, do have the capability to retain the selection, so
when using those, this property should be set to false.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Interval time (in milliseconds) for the table update timer.
Setting this to 0 clears the timer.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
The right inset of the pane. The right inset is the maximum of the
top right widget width and the scrollbar width (if visible).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The right inset of the pane
@return.desc: The right inset of the pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the pane's width

@param.name: @param
@param.body: width {Integer} The pane's width

@description.name: @description
@description.body: overridden

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
id {String} ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
the part in front of the #.
@param.description:
ID of the child control. If a # is used, the id is
the part in front of the #.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
hash {String?undefined} If a child control name contains a #,
all text following the # will be the hash argument.
@param.description:
If a child control name contains a #,
all text following the # will be the hash argument.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The created control or null

Updates the maximum of the horizontal scroll bar, so it corresponds to the

Updates the maximum of the vertical scroll bar, so it corresponds to the

the position where to show the line (in pixels, relative to

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hides the feedback shown while a column is moved by the user.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the focus to the cell that's located at the page position pageX/pageY. If there is no cell at that position, nothing happens.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the x position in the page (in pixels).
@param.description: the x position in the page (in pixels).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageY {Integer} the y position in the page (in pixels).
@param.description: the y position in the page (in pixels).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the currently focused cell.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the focused cell's column.
@param.description: the model index of the focused cell's column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: row {Integer} the model index of the focused cell's row.
@param.description: the model index of the focused cell's row.

@description.body: Returns the column of currently focused cell.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the focused cell's column.
@return.desc: the model index of the focused cell's column.

@return.desc: the model index of the focused cell's column.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Scrolls a cell visible.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: col {Integer} the model index of the column the cell belongs to.
@param.description: the model index of the column the cell belongs to.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: row {Integer} the model index of the row the cell belongs to.
@param.description: the model index of the row the cell belongs to.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns whether currently a cell is editing.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} whether currently a cell is editing.
@return.desc: whether currently a cell is editing.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Starts editing the currently focused cell. Does nothing if already
editing, if the column is not editable, or if the cell editor for the
column ascertains that the particular cell is not editable.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} whether editing was started

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops editing and writes the editor's value to the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Writes the editor's value to the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Stops editing without writing the editor's value to the model.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler. Called when the modal window of the cell editor closes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {Map} the event.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the model index of the column the pointer is over or null if the pointer
is not over a column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).
@param.description: the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the column the pointer is over.
@return.desc: the model index of the column the pointer is over.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the model index of the column that should be resized when dragging
starts here. Returns -1 if the pointer is in no resize region of any column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).
@param.description: the x position of the pointer in the page (in pixels).

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the column index.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the model index of the row the pointer is currently over. Returns -1 if
the pointer is over the header. Returns null if the pointer is not over any
column.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageX {Integer} the pointer x position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer x position in the page.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: pageY {Integer} the pointer y position in the page.
@param.description: the pointer y position in the page.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.
@return.desc: the model index of the row the pointer is currently over.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Sets the widget that should be shown in the top right corner.

The widget will not be disposed, when this table scroller is disposed. So the
caller has to dispose it.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: widget {qx.ui.core.Widget} The widget to set. May be null.
@param.description: The widget to set. May be null.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the top right widget

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.Widget} The top right widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the header.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.pane.Header} the header.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the table pane.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.table.pane.Pane} the table pane.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the rendered width of the vertical scroll bar. The return value is 0 if the scroll bar is invisible or not yet rendered.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The width of the vertical scroll bar
@return.desc: The width of the vertical scroll bar

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns which scrollbars are needed.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
forceHorizontal {Boolean ? false} Whether to show the horizontal
scrollbar always.
@param.description:
Whether to show the horizontal
scrollbar always.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
preventVertical {Boolean ? false} Whether to show the vertical scrollbar
never.
@param.description:
Whether to show the vertical scrollbar
never.

@return.name: @return

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Return the pane clipper. It is sometimes required for special activities
such as tracking events for drag&drop.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.table.pane.Clipper}
The pane clipper for this scroller.
@return.desc: The pane clipper for this scroller.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the scroll area container widget (which enables more precise
operations e.g. bounds retrieval for drag session scrolling).

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.table.pane.Clipper}
The pane clipper for this scroller.
@return.desc: The pane clipper for this scroller.

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Starts the current running interval

@param.body: timeout {Integer} The timeout between two table updates
@param.description: The timeout between two table updates

@description.name: @description
@description.body: stops the current running interval

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Does a postponed update of the content.

@description.name: @description
@description
@description.body:
Updates the content. Sets the right section the table pane should show and
does the scrolling.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Updates the location and the visibility of the focus indicator.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Creates a new scrollbar. This can either be a styled qooxdoo scrollbar
or a native browser scrollbar.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: orientation {String?"horizontal"} The initial scroll bar orientation

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.ui.core.scroll.IScrollBar} The scrollbar instance
